title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document the detailed requirements for the TeamEnergyFlowVisualizer project, including data sources (user activities logs, project management tools, feedback surveys), visualization types (line charts, bar graphs, heatmaps, gauge meters), user interactions (filtering, sorting, drill-downs, alerts), performance metrics (task completion rates, team morale indicators, workflow efficiency), and non-functional requirements such as security (data encryption, user access controls), scalability (handling large datasets, maintaining performance under load), maintainability (code modularity, documentation standards), usability (user-friendly interface, accessible design) and reliability (error handling, system resilience). Review and update the list of requirements based on current best practices and team feedback. Once complete, present to the team for review and refinement.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including data ingestion, processing, storage, and visualization components, as well as the integration points with existing systems.

title: Define Data Model and Schema
description: Design the data model and schema for storing and processing team productivity and morale data, considering scalability, performance, and security requirements. The data model should include entities for teams, projects, tasks, and individuals, as well as metrics for productivity, morale, and other relevant factors. The schema should be optimized for efficient querying and data retrieval, while ensuring data integrity and security.

title: Develop Data Ingestion and Processing Pipeline
description: Implement the data ingestion and processing components to collect, transform, and load team productivity and morale data into the defined data store.

title: Design and Implement Visualization Components
description: Design and develop the user interface components for visualizing team productivity and morale data as 'energy flows', including interactive features and customization options.
